div1.p: United States Consulate at St Paul de Loanda
L. de R. du Verge to Depart. of State
Subject Arrival of Henry M, Stanley of wreck of British African Mail S.S. "Ethiopia"
United States Consulate at St Paul de Loanda S.W.C. Africa Augt. 7th 1882
To Honorable J.C. Bancroft Davis Asst. Secty. of State Washington D.C.

Sir I have the honor to state that Mr. Henry M. Stanley arrived here on board the Belgium Steamer " Heroda" from Banana, very ill on the 25th of July, and has resided since at the Netherland and German Consulate. He wll leave by the Portuguese Mail steamer for Madenia, and perhaps Europe. His sickness has prevented me so far obtainng from him any information that may be of value to the State Depart.

I have also the honor to report that the loss of the British African Maill S.S. "Ethiopia" Capt Simonds. which struch on the Indian Rocks off Indian pomit Latt. 4'" 32' South, and 11" 45' long East on the 29th of July 1882 7 a.m. The steamer was abandoned by force
to the natives by her Capt. officers and crew comperishing 79. souls.

The steamer and cargo are a total loss but am told that both are well insured she had on board 2 packages addressed to this consulate which are lost; and having not received any news from the U.S. last month I am afraid that it might have been some thanks form or othes seut to me by the state Dept. The Indian pomt, and shoal which rim in a W.S.W. direction to a distance of 1 3/4 miles has at its furthermass and many sharp pointed rocks on which the "Ethiopia" was wrecked: The loss of said steamer happening in day time, calm weather and smooth seas cannot but be attributed to gross conefessoness, and rather too much trust in the park of the master to some African white traders of Loanda a Trading settlement 3 miles off Indian point passengers witg h bornm and representing themselves a thoroughly acquainted with the coast and
22. particulary the Indian pomt and shove. The crew now here under the British Conserl;s care are far from behaving themselves and are daily and nightly seen drunk, and as Bilious or green fever and Dysentry are raging at present among Europeans the half of them may soon be in the hospital
I have the honor to be Sir Your obedient servant L de R. du Verge U.S. Consul.
